'''''Gymnopilus humicola''''' is a species of [[mushroom]] in the [[Cortinariaceae]] family.

==Description==
The [[pileus (mycology)|cap]] is {{convert|1|to|5|cm|in|1}} in diameter.<ref name="isbn0-945345-39-9">{{cite book |author=Hesler LR. |title=North American Species of ''Gymnopilus'' (Mycologia Memoir Series: No 3) |publisher=Lubrecht & Cramer Ltd |location=Knoxville, Tennessee |year=1969 |pages=67–68 |isbn=0-945345-39-9}}</ref>

==Habitat and distribution==
''Gymnopilus humicola'' grows on [[humus]], in [[coniferous]] and [[deciduous]] woods. It has been found in Michigan, Idaho, Tennessee, and Washington. It fruits from June to September.<ref name="isbn0-945345-39-9"/>
